nodes.bodyText: I would unify this note across both examples.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -26,6 +26,17 @@ mvn clean package
 java -jar ./target/dmn-springboot-example.jar
 ```
 
+## Listener injection
+
+Kogito allows you to inject custom instances of `DMNRuntimeEventListener` if you need to attach custom logic to every DMN model evaluation.
+
+There are two ways to do this:
+* Create one or more standard listener classes and annotate them with `Component` (the quickest way to inject a single listener). Demonstrated in `ExampleDMNRuntimeEventListener` class.
+* Create one or more instances of `DecisionEventListenerConfig` (returning a list of listeners each) and annotate them with `Component`. Demonstrated in `ExampleDecisionEventListenerConfig` class.
+
+All the listeners instantiated with both methods will be injected during the application startup phase.
+
+**Important:** everything that this section describes is *OPTIONAL*: if you don't need listeners, just ignore it.

nodes.bodyText: Ok, shall I use this exact sentence also in Quarkus README then?

nodes.bodyText: @MarianMacik I didn't use the same sentence as Quarkus because it says "you can have a Quarkus application that runs DMN models on Kogito without writing a single line of Java code" but in the Spring Boot application there's one Java class (KogitoSpringbootApplication) 😅

nodes.bodyText: Now that we're using separate examples I wrote a sentence regarding the optionality of listeners directly in the Description section of each README.md file (the same for both as you requested).
